meanings.definition: To voluntarily leave a job or position.
meanings.sent1: She is resigning from her job to spend more time with her family.
meanings.sent2: He will be resigning from his position as manager next week.
meanings.sent3: After resigning from his job, he realized he could pursue his passion for painting.
meanings.sent4: The old captain was resigning his command to the new leader.
meanings.sent5: Resigning from the company felt like a weight lifted off her shoulders.

meanings.definition: To accept that something undesirable cannot be avoided.
meanings.sent1: They were resigning themselves to the fact that the flight was delayed.
meanings.sent2: She was resigning to the reality that her favorite show was canceled.
meanings.sent3: Resigning to the rainy weather, they decided to have a cozy movie night indoors.
meanings.sent4: The team was resigning to the inevitable defeat in the final match.
meanings.sent5: Resigning to the situation, he decided to make the best of it.

meanings.definition: To give up or relinquish something.
meanings.sent1: He was resigning his claim to the throne in favor of his younger brother.
meanings.sent2: She was resigning her spot in line to let the elderly lady go first.
meanings.sent3: Resigning his dessert to his little sister, he made her day.
meanings.sent4: The general was resigning his command to retire in peace.
meanings.sent5: Resigning his dreams of fame, he found contentment in a simple life.
